info.title: AssemblyAI
info.description: Transcribe and extract data from audio using AssemblyAI's Speech AI.

post.description: Upload a media file to AssemblyAI's servers.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

post.description: Create a transcript from a media file that is accessible via a URL.

200.description: Transcript created and queued for processing

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description:
Retrieve a list of transcripts you created.
Transcripts are sorted from newest to oldest. The previous URL always points to a page with older transcripts.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum amount of transcripts to retrieve

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of your transcript. Possible values are queued, processing, completed, or error.

parameters.name: created_on
parameters.description: Only get transcripts created on this date

parameters.name: before_id
parameters.description: Get transcripts that were created before this transcript ID

parameters.name: after_id
parameters.description: Get transcripts that were created after this transcript ID

parameters.name: throttled_only
parameters.description: Only get throttled transcripts, overrides the status filter

200.description: A list of transcripts. Transcripts are sorted from newest to oldest. The previous URL always points to a page with older transcripts.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description: Get the transcript resource. The transcript is ready when the "status" is "completed".

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

delete.description:
Delete the transcript.
Deleting does not delete the resource itself, but removes the data from the resource and marks it as deleted.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description: Export your transcript in SRT or VTT format to use with a video player for subtitles and closed captions.

parameters.name: chars_per_caption
parameters.description: The maximum number of characters per caption

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description: Get the transcript split by sentences. The API will attempt to semantically segment the transcript into sentences to create more reader-friendly transcripts.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description: Get the transcript split by paragraphs. The API will attempt to semantically segment your transcript into paragraphs to create more reader-friendly transcripts.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description: Search through the transcript for keywords. You can search for individual words, numbers, or phrases containing up to five words or numbers.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description: Retrieve the redacted audio object containing the status and URL to the redacted audio.

200.description: The redacted audio object containing the status and URL to the redacted audio

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

post.description: Use the LeMUR task endpoint to input your own LLM prompt.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: Maximum number of allowed requests in a 60 second window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Number of remaining requests in the current time window.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: Number of seconds until the remaining requests resets to the value of X-RateLimit-Limit.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

get.description: Retrieve a LeMUR response that was previously generated.

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the LeMUR request you previously made.
This would be found in the response of the original request.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

delete.description:
Delete the data for a previously submitted LeMUR request.
The LLM response data, as well as any context provided in the original request will be removed.

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description: The ID of the LeMUR request whose data you want to delete. This would be found in the response of the original request.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request

status.description: The status of the redacted audio

redacted_audio_url.description: The URL of the redacted audio file

total_count.description: The total count of all matched instances. For e.g., word 1 matched 2 times, and word 2 matched 3 times, total_count will equal 5.

count.description: The total amount of times the word is in the transcript

items.description: An array of timestamps structured as [start_time, end_time] in milliseconds

indexes.description: An array of all index locations for that word within the words array of the completed transcript

TranscriptParams.description: The parameters for creating a transcript

audio_url.description: The URL of the audio or video file to transcribe.

language_code.description:
The language of your audio file. Possible values are found in Supported Languages.
The default value is 'en_us'.

language_detection.description: Enable Automatic language detection, either true or false.

speech_model.description: The speech model to use for the transcription.

punctuate.description: Enable Automatic Punctuation, can be true or false

format_text.description: Enable Text Formatting, can be true or false

disfluencies.description: Transcribe Filler Words, like "umm", in your media file; can be true or false

dual_channel.description: Enable Dual Channel transcription, can be true or false.

webhook_url.description: The URL to which we send webhook requests. We sends two different types of webhook requests. One request when a transcript is completed or failed, and one request when the redacted audio is ready if redact_pii_audio is enabled.

webhook_auth_header_name.description: The header name to be sent with the transcript completed or failed webhook requests

webhook_auth_header_value.description: The header value to send back with the transcript completed or failed webhook requests for added security

auto_highlights.description: Enable Key Phrases, either true or false

audio_start_from.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, to begin transcribing in your media file

audio_end_at.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, to stop transcribing in your media file

word_boost.description: The list of custom vocabulary to boost transcription probability for

boost_param.description: How much to boost specified words

filter_profanity.description: Filter profanity from the transcribed text, can be true or false

redact_pii.description: Redact PII from the transcribed text using the Redact PII model, can be true or false

redact_pii_audio.description: Generate a copy of the original media file with spoken PII "beeped" out, can be true or false. See PII redaction for more details.

redact_pii_audio_quality.description: Controls the filetype of the audio created by redact_pii_audio. Currently supports mp3 (default) and wav. See PII redaction for more details.

redact_pii_policies.description: The list of PII Redaction policies to enable. See PII redaction for more details.

items.description: The type of PII to redact

redact_pii_sub.description: The replacement logic for detected PII, can be "entity_name" or "hash". See PII redaction for more details.

speaker_labels.description: Enable Speaker diarization, can be true or false

speakers_expected.description: Tells the speaker label model how many speakers it should attempt to identify, up to 10. See Speaker diarization for more details.

content_safety.description: Enable Content Moderation, can be true or false

content_safety_confidence.description: The confidence threshold for the Content Moderation model. Values must be between 25 and 100.

iab_categories.description: Enable Topic Detection, can be true or false

custom_spelling.description: Customize how words are spelled and formatted using to and from values

items.description: Object containing words or phrases to replace, and the word or phrase to replace with

to.description: Word or phrase to replace with

sentiment_analysis.description: Enable Sentiment Analysis, can be true or false

auto_chapters.description: Enable Auto Chapters, can be true or false

entity_detection.description: Enable Entity Detection, can be true or false

speech_threshold.description:
Reject audio files that contain less than this fraction of speech.
Valid values are in the range [0, 1] inclusive.

summarization.description: Enable Summarization, can be true or false

summary_model.description: The model to summarize the transcript

custom_topics.description: Enable custom topics, either true or false

id.description: The unique identifier of your transcript

audio_url.description: The URL of the media that was transcribed

status.description: The status of your transcript. Possible values are queued, processing, completed, or error.

language_code.description:
The language of your audio file.
Possible values are found in Supported Languages.
The default value is 'en_us'.

language_detection.description: Whether Automatic language detection is enabled, either true or false

speech_model.description: The speech model to use for the transcription.

text.description: The textual transcript of your media file

words.description:
An array of temporally-sequential word objects, one for each word in the transcript.
See Speech recognition for more information.

speaker.description: The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null

utterances.description:
When dual_channel or speaker_labels is enabled, a list of turn-by-turn utterance objects.
See Speaker diarization for more information.

confidence.description: The confidence score for the transcript of this utterance

start.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, of the utterance in the audio file

end.description: The ending time, in milliseconds, of the utterance in the audio file

speaker.description: The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null
The speaker of this utterance, where each speaker is assigned a sequential capital letter - e.g. "A" for Speaker A, "B" for Speaker B, etc.

confidence.description: The confidence score for the transcript, between 0.0 (low confidence) and 1.0 (high confidence)

audio_duration.description: The duration of this transcript object's media file, in seconds

punctuate.description: Whether Automatic Punctuation is enabled, either true or false

format_text.description: Whether Text Formatting is enabled, either true or false

disfluencies.description: Transcribe Filler Words, like "umm", in your media file; can be true or false

dual_channel.description: Whether Dual channel transcription was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

webhook_url.description:
The URL to which we send webhook requests.
We sends two different types of webhook requests.
One request when a transcript is completed or failed, and one request when the redacted audio is ready if redact_pii_audio is enabled.

webhook_status_code.description: The status code we received from your server when delivering the transcript completed or failed webhook request, if a webhook URL was provided

webhook_auth.description: Whether webhook authentication details were provided

webhook_auth_header_name.description: The header name to be sent with the transcript completed or failed webhook requests

auto_highlights.description: Whether Key Phrases is enabled, either true or false

auto_highlights_result.description:
An array of results for the Key Phrases model, if it is enabled.
See Key phrases for more information.

status.description: Either success, or unavailable in the rare case that the model failed

results.description: A temporally-sequential array of Key Phrases

count.description: The total number of times the key phrase appears in the audio file

rank.description: The total relevancy to the overall audio file of this key phrase - a greater number means more relevant

text.description: The text itself of the key phrase

timestamps.description: The timestamp of the of the key phrase

items.description: Timestamp containing a start and end property in milliseconds

audio_start_from.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, in the file at which the transcription was started

audio_end_at.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, in the file at which the transcription was terminated

word_boost.description: The list of custom vocabulary to boost transcription probability for

filter_profanity.description: Whether Profanity Filtering is enabled, either true or false

redact_pii.description: Whether PII Redaction is enabled, either true or false

redact_pii_audio.description:
Whether a redacted version of the audio file was generated,
either true or false. See PII redaction for more information.

redact_pii_audio_quality.description: Controls the filetype of the audio created by redact_pii_audio. Currently supports mp3 (default) and wav. See PII redaction for more details.

redact_pii_policies.description:
The list of PII Redaction policies that were enabled, if PII Redaction is enabled.
See PII redaction for more information.

items.description: The type of PII to redact

redact_pii_sub.description: The replacement logic for detected PII, can be "entity_name" or "hash". See PII redaction for more details.

speaker_labels.description: Whether Speaker diarization is enabled, can be true or false

speakers_expected.description: Tell the speaker label model how many speakers it should attempt to identify, up to 10. See Speaker diarization for more details.

content_safety.description: Whether Content Moderation is enabled, can be true or false

content_safety_labels.description:
An array of results for the Content Moderation model, if it is enabled.
See Content moderation for more information.

status.description: Either success, or unavailable in the rare case that the model failed

text.description: The transcript of the section flagged by the Content Moderation model

labels.description: An array of safety labels, one per sensitive topic that was detected in the section

label.description: The label of the sensitive topic

confidence.description: The confidence score for the topic being discussed, from 0 to 1

severity.description: How severely the topic is discussed in the section, from 0 to 1

sentences_idx_start.description: The sentence index at which the section begins

sentences_idx_end.description: The sentence index at which the section ends

timestamp.description: Timestamp containing a start and end property in milliseconds

summary.description: A summary of the Content Moderation confidence results for the entire audio file

additionalProperties.description: A confidence score for the presence of the sensitive topic "topic" across the entire audio file

severity_score_summary.description: A summary of the Content Moderation severity results for the entire audio file

iab_categories.description: Whether Topic Detection is enabled, can be true or false

iab_categories_result.description:
The result of the Topic Detection model, if it is enabled.
See Topic Detection for more information.

status.description: Either success, or unavailable in the rare case that the model failed

results.description: An array of results for the Topic Detection model

items.description: The result of the topic detection model

text.description: The text in the transcript in which a detected topic occurs

relevance.description: How relevant the detected topic is of a detected topic

label.description: The IAB taxonomical label for the label of the detected topic, where > denotes supertopic/subtopic relationship

timestamp.description: Timestamp containing a start and end property in milliseconds

summary.description: The overall relevance of topic to the entire audio file

custom_spelling.description: Customize how words are spelled and formatted using to and from values

items.description: Object containing words or phrases to replace, and the word or phrase to replace with

to.description: Word or phrase to replace with

auto_chapters.description: Whether Auto Chapters is enabled, can be true or false

chapters.description: An array of temporally sequential chapters for the audio file

gist.description: An ultra-short summary (just a few words) of the content spoken in the chapter

headline.description: A single sentence summary of the content spoken during the chapter

summary.description: A one paragraph summary of the content spoken during the chapter

start.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, for the chapter

end.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, for the chapter

summarization.description: Whether Summarization is enabled, either true or false

summary_type.description: The type of summary generated, if Summarization is enabled

summary_model.description:
The Summarization model used to generate the summary,
if Summarization is enabled

summary.description: The generated summary of the media file, if Summarization is enabled

custom_topics.description: Whether custom topics is enabled, either true or false

topics.description: The list of custom topics provided if custom topics is enabled

sentiment_analysis.description: Whether Sentiment Analysis is enabled, can be true or false

sentiment_analysis_results.description:
An array of results for the Sentiment Analysis model, if it is enabled.
See Sentiment Analysis for more information.

items.description: The result of the Sentiment Analysis model

start.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, of the sentence

end.description: The ending time, in milliseconds, of the sentence

sentiment.description: The detected sentiment for the sentence, one of POSITIVE, NEUTRAL, NEGATIVE

confidence.description: The confidence score for the detected sentiment of the sentence, from 0 to 1

speaker.description: The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null

entity_detection.description: Whether Entity Detection is enabled, can be true or false

entities.description:
An array of results for the Entity Detection model, if it is enabled.
See Entity detection for more information.

entity_type.description: The type of entity for the detected entity

text.description: The text for the detected entity

start.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, at which the detected entity appears in the audio file

end.description: The ending time, in milliseconds, for the detected entity in the audio file

speech_threshold.description:
Defaults to null. Reject audio files that contain less than this fraction of speech.
Valid values are in the range [0, 1] inclusive.

throttled.description: True while a request is throttled and false when a request is no longer throttled

error.description: Error message of why the transcript failed

language_model.description: The language model that was used for the transcript

acoustic_model.description: The acoustic model that was used for the transcript

speaker.description: The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null
The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null
The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null
The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null

TranscriptList.description: A list of transcripts. Transcripts are sorted from newest to oldest. The previous URL always points to a page with older transcripts.

page_details.description: Details of the transcript page. Transcripts are sorted from newest to oldest. The previous URL always points to a page with older transcripts.

limit.description: The number of results this page is limited to

result_count.description: The actual number of results in the page

current_url.description: The URL used to retrieve the current page of transcripts

prev_url.description: The URL to the next page of transcripts. The previous URL always points to a page with older transcripts.

next_url.description: The URL to the next page of transcripts. The next URL always points to a page with newer transcripts.

status.description: The status of your transcript. Possible values are queued, processing, completed, or error.

error.description: Error message of why the transcript failed

upload_url.description: A URL that points to your audio file, accessible only by AssemblyAI's servers

request_id.description: The ID of the deletion request of the LeMUR request

request_id_to_purge.description: The ID of the LeMUR request to purge the data for

deleted.description: Whether the request data was deleted

request_id.description: The ID of the LeMUR request

usage.description: The usage numbers for the LeMUR request

input_tokens.description: The number of input tokens used by the model

output_tokens.description: The number of output tokens generated by the model

request_id.description: The ID of the LeMUR request

usage.description: The usage numbers for the LeMUR request

input_tokens.description: The number of input tokens used by the model

output_tokens.description: The number of output tokens generated by the model

prompt.description: Your text to prompt the model to produce a desired output, including any context you want to pass into the model.

transcript_ids.description:
A list of completed transcripts with text. Up to a maximum of 100 files or 100 hours, whichever is lower.
Use either transcript_ids or input_text as input into LeMUR.

input_text.description:
Custom formatted transcript data. Maximum size is the context limit of the selected model, which defaults to 100000.
Use either transcript_ids or input_text as input into LeMUR.

context.description: Context to provide the model. This can be a string or a free-form JSON value.

final_model.description: The model that is used for the final prompt after compression is performed.

max_output_size.description: Max output size in tokens, up to 4000

temperature.description:
The temperature to use for the model.
Higher values result in answers that are more creative, lower values are more conservative.
Can be any value between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.
